s2.title: Unmanaged Pools
s2.p: There are two unmanaged pool types in MPool: FixedSizePool and BlockingFixedSizePool. They are similar to one another, but differ in how they respond to insufficient resources. The FixedSizePool fails fast, and throws an exception. The BlockingFixedSizePool tries to wait for a specified number of milliseconds.

The Fixed Size Pools are not managed because they will only have a certain number of pooled objects at any time. They will never grow or shrink. They are useful for instances where the number of elements are known in advanced. One example is a JDBC connection pool because some vendors require you to pay per connection licensing fees.
